utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Eh..., I don't, I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, as old as he is in dog years, do you think Snoopy should still be allowed to fly this thing?

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Do you remember when you first came here, how you spent two weeks getting trained by another waitress?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, sure! Do you need me to train somebody new?

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Good one. Actually, ah, Terry wants you to take the training again, whenever.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Eh, do you believe that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: So that's two boxes of the Holiday Macaroons. On behalf of the Brown Birds of America, I salute you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Just admit it Chandler, you have no backhand.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Excuse me little one, I have a very solid backhand.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Shielding your face and shrieking like a girl... is not a backhand.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I was shrieking... like a Marine.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right here. Watch me execute the three 'P's of championship play. Power. Precision. and penache.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You broke a little girl's leg?!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know. I feel horrible. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Says here that a muppet got whacked on Seasame Street last night. Where exactly were around ten-ish?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I'm gonna go see her. I want to bring her something, what do you think she'll like?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Maybe a Hello Kitty doll, the ability to walk...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm gonna get back to retraining.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, see you guys.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look out kids, he's coming!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And I gotta go sell some Christmas trees.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Have fun. Oh wait, no, don't! I forgot I am totally against that now.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What? Me having a job?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, no, I am against innocent trees being cut down in their prime, and their, their corpses grotesquely dressed in like tinsel and twinkly lights. Hey, how do you sleep at night?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I'm pretty tired from lugging the trees around all day. Hey, Phoebe listen, you got this all wrong. Those trees were born to be Christmas trees, their fulfilling their life purpose, by, by making people happy.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, and ah, ah, the trees are happy too, because for most of them, it's the only chance to see New York.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: ...and after you've delivered the drinks, you take the empty tray....

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Gunther, Gunther, please, I've worked here for two and a half years, I know the empty trays go over there.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: What if you put them here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Huh. Well, y'know that's actually a really good idea, because that way they'll be closer to the mugs. Y'know what, you should have the other waitresses do that too.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: They already do. That's why they call it the 'tray spot.'

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Gee, I always heard them talk about that, I just always thought that it was a club they went to. Oh God, I'm, I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: It's all right. Sweetheart.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, this must be kinda neat for ya, huh? I mean, your Dad tells me that you get a couple of days off school, and you, you ah, don't have to sell those cookies anymore.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Well, I kinda wanted to sell the cookies. The girl who sells the most wins a trip to Spacecamp, and gets to sit in a real space shuttle.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow, you ah, you really like all this space stuff, huh?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Yeah. My Dad says if I spend as much time helping him clean apartments, as I do daydreaming about outer space, he'd be able to afford a trip to the Taj Mahal.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I think you would have to clean a whole lot of apartments to go all the way to India.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: No. The one in Atlantic City, Dad loves the slots. He says he's gonna double the college money my Grandma left me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh. Well, good luck to Dad. Say, how many more boxes would you have to sell in order to win?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: The girl who won last year sold four hundred and seventy-five.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: So far, I've sold seventy-five.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Four hundred, huh? Well, that sounds do-able. How much are the boxes?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Five dollars a box.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And what is second prize?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: A ten speed bike. But, I'd rather have something my Dad couldn't sell.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, that makes sense.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Could you do me one favor, if it's not too much trouble?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, Sarah, anything.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Could you pull open the curtains for me? The astronauts from the space shuttle are gonna be on the news, and since we don't have a TV, the lady across the alley said she'd push hers up to a window, so I could watch it.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Yesss?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi, I'm selling Brown Bird cookies.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: You're no Brown Bird, I can see you through my peephole.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, hi, I'm, I'm an honorary Brown Bird

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah, well, it means that I can sell cookies, but I'm not invited to sleep-overs.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: I can dial 9-1-1 at the touch of a button, y'know. Now, go away!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, please, please, um, it's for a poor little girl who wants to go to Spacecamp more than anything in the world.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: I'm pressing, a policeman is on his way.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, okay! I'm going. I'm going.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: I can still see you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey. What, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I-I thought a lot about what you said, and um, I realilized duh, all right maybe I was a little judgmental. Yeah, oh, but oh...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look now, Phoebe remember, hey, their just fulfilling their Christmas....

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Destiny.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. Yikes! That one doesn't look very fulfilled.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, that's, that's ah, one of the old ones, he's just taking it to the back.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You keep the old ones in the back, that is so ageist.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well we have to make room for the fresh ones.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So, what happens to the old guys?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, they go into the chipper.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why, do I have a feeling that's not as happy as it sounds? No! Nooooo!!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Hey!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ...and these come in the shapes of your favourite Christmas characters, Santa, Rudolph, and Baby Jesus.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, I'll take a box of the cream filled Jesus's.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wait a minute, one box! Come on, I'm trying to send a little girl to Spacecamp, I'm putting you down for five boxes. Chandler, what about you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ahh, do you have any coconut flavoured deities?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, but ah, there's coconut in the Hanukkah Menoreoes. I tell you what, I'll put you down for eight boxes, one for each night.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mon?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, I'll take one box of the mint treasures, just one, and that's it. I-I started gaining weight after I joined the Brown Birds. Remember, how Dad bought all my boxes and I ate them all?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah, no Mon, Dad had to buy everyone of your boxes because you ate them all. But ah, y'know I'm sure that's not gonna happen this time, why don't I put you down for three of the mint treasures and just a couple of the Rudolph's.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, come on, now you know you want 'em.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Don't, don't, don't, don't, don't do this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'll tell you what Mon, I'll give you the first box for free.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh God! I gotta go!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on! All the cool kids are eating 'em!

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: And when you have a second later, I wanna show you why we don't just trap spiders under coffee mugs and leave them there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm training to be better at a job that I hate, my life officially sucks.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look Rach, wasn't this supposed to a temporary thing? I thought you wanted to do fashion stuff?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, yeah! I'm still pursuing that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How... exactly are you pursuing that? Y'know other than sending out resumes like what, two years ago?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I'm also sending out.... good thoughts.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: If you ask me, as long as you got this job, you've got nothing pushing you to get another one. You need the fear.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: The fear?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He's right, if you quit this job, you then have motivation to go after a job you really want.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well then how come you're still at a job that you hate, I mean why don't you quit and get 'the fear'?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because, I'm too afraid.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don't know, I mean I would give anything to work for a designer, y'know, or a buyer.... Oh, I just don't want to be 30 and still work here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, that'd be much worse than being 28, and still working here.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Remind me to review with you which pot is decaf and which is regular.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Can't I just look at the handles on them?

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: You would think.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Gunther, y'know what, I am a terrible waitress, do you know why I'm a terrible waitress? Because, I don't care. I don't care. I don't care which pot is regular and which pot is decaf, I don't care where the tray spot is, I just don't care, this is not what I want to do. So I don't think I should do it anymore. I'm gonna give you my weeks notice.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Gunther, I quit.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Does this mean we're gonna have to start paying for coffee?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I spelled out boobies.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, but me down for another box of the mint treasures, okay. Where, where are the mint treasures?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah, we're out. I sold them all.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Monica, I'm cutting you off.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No. No, just, just, just a couple more boxes. It-it-it's no big deal, all right, I'm-I'm cool. You gotta help me out with a couple more boxes!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mon, look at yourself. You have cookie on your neck.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh God!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, how many have you sold so far?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Check this out. Five hundred and seventeen boxes!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my God, how did you do that?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, the other night I was leaving the museum just as 'Laser Floyd' was letting out of the planetarium, without even trying I sold 50 boxes! That's when it occurred to me, the key to my success, 'the munchies.' So I ah, started hitting the NYU dorms around midnight. I am selling cookies by the case. They call me: 'Cookie Dude!'

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, stop what you're doing, I need envelope stuffers, I need stamp lickers.....

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well hey, who did these resumes for ya?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Me! On my computer.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well you sure used a large font.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Eh, yeah, well ah, waitress at a coffee shop and cheer squad co-captain only took up so much room.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey-hey-hey that's funny! Your funny Chandler! Your a funny guy! You wanna know what else is really funny?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Something else I might have said?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don't know, I don't know, weren't you the guy that told me to quit my job when I had absolutely nothing else to do. Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sweetie, calm down, it's gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, it's not gonna be okay Ross, tomorrow is my last day, and I don't have a lead. Okay, y'know what, I'm just gonna, I'm just gonna call Gunther and I'm gonna tell him, I'm not quitting.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You-you-you don't wanna give into the fear.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You and your stupid fear. I hate your fear. I would like to take you and your fear....

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! I got great news!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Run, Joey! Run for your life!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What? Rachel, listen, have you ever heard of Fortunata Fashions?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well my old man is doing a plumbing job down there and he heard they have an opening. So, you want me to see if I can get you an interview?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! Yes, I would love that, oh, that is soo sweet, Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Not a problem.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And now for the great news.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What, that wasn't the great news?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Only if you think it's better than this... snow-in-a-can!! I got it at work. Mon, you want me to decorate the window, give it a kind of Christmas lookie.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Christmas cookie?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, and ah, this one here is a Douglas Fir, now it's a little more money, but you get a nicer smell.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Looks good. I'll take it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait! No, no, you don't want that one. No, you can have this cool brown one.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: It's-it's-it's almost dead!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay but that's why you have to buy it, so it can fulfil it's Christmas destiny, otherwise there gonna throw it into the chipper. Tell him, Joey

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, the ah, trees that don't fulfil their Christmas destiny are thrown in the chipper.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: I-I think I'm gonna look around a little bit more.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pheebs, you gotta stop this, I working on commission here.

utterance.content: Hey, guys. I'm here to pick out my Christmas tree.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well look no further, this one's yours! Ahhh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Is this the one that I threw out last year?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right y'know what, nevermind! Everyone wants to have a green one! I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to get so emotional, I guess it's just the holidays, it's hard.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh honey, is that 'cause your Mom died around Christmas?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I wasn't even thinking about that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi there. How many, how many ah, did you sell?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: I'm not gonna tell you! You're the bad man who broke Sarah's leg.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey now! That was an accident, okay.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: You're a big scrud.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What's a scrud?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Why don't you look in the mirror, scrud.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't have too. I can just look at you.

utterance.speaker: Leader
utterance.content: All right girls, and man. Let's see your final tallies. Ohhhh, Debbie, 321 boxes of cookies, Very nice.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Not nice enough.

utterance.speaker: Leader
utterance.content: Charla, 278. Sorry, dear, but still good.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Good for a scrud.

utterance.speaker: Leader
utterance.content: Oh, yes Elizabeth. Ah, 871.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That's crap!! Sister Brown Bird. Good going.

utterance.speaker: Leader
utterance.content: Who's next?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi there!

utterance.speaker: Leader
utterance.content: Hi. And batting for Sarah, Ross Geller, 872. Although, it looks like you bought an awful lot of cookies yourself.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Um, that is because my doctor says that I have a very serious.... nuget.... diffency.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Tell us what happened, Brown Bird Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I lost. Some little girl loaned her uniform to her nineteen year old sister, who went down to the U.S.S. Nimitz, and sold over 2,000 boxes.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! How'd the interview go?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I blew it. I wouldn't of even hired me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, come here sweetie, listen, you're gonna go on like a thousand interviews before you get a job. That's not how that was supposed to come out.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: This is the worst Christmas ever.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'know what Rach, maybe you should just, y'know stay here at the coffee house.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I can't! It's too late! Terry already hired that girl over there. Look at her, she's even got waitress experience. Last night she was teaching everybody how to make napkin.... swans.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That word was swans.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well seeing that drunk Santa wet himself, really perked up my Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Joey and Monica
utterance.content: Merry Christmas!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You saved them! You guys! Oh God, you're the best!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's like 'Night of the Living Dead Christmas Trees.'

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello? Yeah, this is she. Oh! You're kidding! You're kidding! Oh thank you! I love you!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sure, everybody loves a kidder.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I got the job!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: That's great! Hey! Excellent!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, God bless us, everyone.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Here we go. I'm serving my last cup of coffee. There you go. Enjoy.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Should I tell her I ordered tea?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Um, excuse me, everyone. Ah, this is my last night working here, and I ah, just wanted say that I made some really good friends working here, and ah, it's just time to move on. Ah, and no offence to everybody who ah, still works here, you have no idea how good it feels to say that as of this moment I will never have to make coffee again.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm, I'm sorry you didn't get to go to Spacecamp, and I'm hoping that maybe somehow, this may make up for it. Presenting Sarah Tuttle's Private Very Special Spacecamp!!
